content: According to data from the Telangana Development Planning Society (TGDPS), Ibrahimpatnam in Jagtial district reported the highest maximum temperature at 41.5°C

title: Those opposing Sangh’s work will join us one day, says Dattatreya Hosabale
content: In 100 years, the Sangh has travelled from neglect and ridicule to curiosity and acceptance, the RSS general secretary said on the centenary of the saffron organisation.

title: Grandeur marks Ugadi celebrations in Chittoor
content: Collector emphasises the importance of preserving traditions and respecting elders, while SP appeals to the parents to impart Telugu language skills to their children

title: During visit to Chhattisgarh, Modi blames Congress’ policies for Maoism

title: Ambedkar Porata Samithi to hold protest in New Delhi on March 31 for implementation of Communal Award
content: Separate electorate system under Communal Award will ensure real benefit for SC and STs, says Samithi president

title: Kurnool administration to rope in SHGs to set up water kiosks in villages
content: Medical and health department officials instructed to make ORS packets, IV fluids, and necessary medicines available at all PHCs and CHCs

title: Family of four die by suicide in Madakasira town
content: Krishnamachari, 40 had reportedly run into huge debts after opening his own jewellery shop. Under immense pressure from the moneylenders, he is believed to have taken the extreme step

title: Odisha CM Majhi to launch 'Antyodaya Gruha Yojana' in Kalahandi district on March 30
content: Odisha CM to launch ₹7,550 crore housing scheme in Kalahandi district, benefiting 50,000 underprivileged citizens

title: Two tmc ft of water from Bhadra reservoir to be released to canals between April 1 and 5
content: As of Sunday (March 30, 2025), Bhadra has 28 tmc ft of live storage, with 11 tmc ft needed for irrigation till May 8 and 14 tmc ft for drinking water, leaving a cushion of 3 tmc ft

title: In poll-bound Bihar, Amit Shah urges people to press ‘lotus’ to ensure the return of NDA government
content: The Home Minister alleged that Lalu Prasad’s government created a new record of scams by doing tar scam, flood relief scam, railway hotel scam, soil scam, fodder scam and land for job scam

title: Security beefed up across Jharkhand in view of Eid, Ram Navami

title: Third edition of AIAC hosts 21 artists from nine ASEAN countries
content: Over 10 days, artists will create original works, take part in workshops on classical dance, music, and handicrafts, and explore India’s artistic traditions in a collaborative setting

title: Maoist surrenders double in first quarter; CRPF intelligence gets active
content: CRPF intelligence unit persuades Maoists to surrender, reshaping CPI (Maoist) ideology towards mainstream, reducing Naxal violence significantly

title: Long stays in postings breed corruption, rotate officers: Parliament panel to govt
content: There has been a rotational policy for all officers but it is not being implemented in toto, the Department-related Parliamentary Standing Committee on Personnel, Public Grievances, Law and Justice said in its 145th report, tabled in Parliament

title: AFSPA extended in Manipur, Nagaland, Arunachal Pradesh for another six months

title: Do not allow alliance to blur independent identity: CPI(M)
content: His assertion assumes significance as the party, subjected to the compulsions of alliance and in the name of opposing the BJP, toes the lines of the ruling dispensation on many issues in Tamil Nadu.

title: SC rejects plea to direct Punjab and Haryana govts to control stubble burning
content: When this court has passed several orders on the issue of stubble burning and is still seized of the matter, we do not want to encourage different parties to file applications for intervention and directions, only for the sake of it.

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu takes part in Ugadi festival celebrations; gives away Kala Ratna, Ugadi awards

content: Cuttack District Collector Shinde said the seven people, whose injuries were serious, were admitted to the State-run SCB Medical College and Hospital (SCB MCH) in Cuttack and that “all of them are stable”

title: 'Never again': Nitish Kumar tells Amit Shah on break-ups with BJP

title: Two workers die of suffocation while cleaning chemical lorry tank in Erode
content: The lorry had transported aluminium chloride from Hyderabad to a dyeing company in Tiruppur, where it is used in effluent treatment plants to remove suspended solids and improve water quality.

title: Does India need to include the mumps vaccine in its universal immunisation programme?
content: Public health experts say the number of mumps cases has exploded in the past few years across several States; introducing a vaccine into the national schedule however, requires careful consideration

title: Gelatin sticks trigger blast at mosque in Beed, no casualty; two held

content: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, Deputy Chief Ministers, several Union and State Ministers and senior officials were also present on the occasion

content: Stalin also criticises RBI allowing banks to charge more for ATM withdrawals, as “institutional extraction”

title: Uttar Pradesh Government bans sale of meat within 500 m of religious places during Navratri
content: Under the provisions of the U.P. Municipal Corporation Act 1959 and the Food Safety Act 2006 and 2011, the Yogi Adityanath Government has directed the officials to take strict punitive action against the violators, the statement said

title: Ugadi Day: Temples witness heavy rush of devotees in Andhra Pradesh
content: Sri Vijayaganapati temple-Srikakulam priests Penta Sridhar Sarma and Penta Nagesh Kumar Sarma performed Abhisekham to the presiding deity

title: Dummy weapons used for film shooting: Madras High Court directs Chennai Police Commissioner to issue certificates, identity cards
content: Justice G.K. Ilanthiraiyan quashes an order passed by the Commissioner of Police on December 20, 2024 refusing to issue the documents to members of South Indian Movies Dummy Effects Association

title: Punjab Police busts trans-border narco-smuggling network, two arrested
content: The DGP said an FIR has been registered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act (NDPS), and further investigation is underway

title: Chennai-bound flight from Jaipur makes emergency landing after damage to tyre, passengers safe
content: After take-off from Jaipur during climb, ATC informed about a piece of tyre found on runway.  Chennai ATC was informed and a precautionary landing carried out

title: Five transgender traffic marshals join Cyberabad police
content: Starting April, they will be stationed at key junctions, ensuring the smooth flow of vehicles in the city’s ever-busy IT corridor.

title: Vizianagaram lawyer Kotla Mohana Rao bags over 200 merit certificates in national-level quiz contests
content: Kotla Mohana Rao won various online competitions conducted by Central departments in the last one and a half years

title: Colours of Kashmir
content: Spring in Kashmir is a time of blossoming hope and the local population welcomes the season of new beginnings as the Valley wakes up from winter’s embrace

title: Centre sanctions ₹25 crore to develop tourism infrastructure at Nagarjuna Sagar in A.P.
content: Funds allocated under ‘Challenge-Based Destination Development’ initiative of Swadesh Darshan 2.0 scheme; APTDC will oversee implementation of the project

title: Work towards improving living standards of poor, Minister tells district officials

title: Energy Minister seeks Central support to develop green energy corridor in A.P.
content: Gottipati Ravi Kumar urges the Centre to implement fuel adjustment charge policy in a timely manner and ensure the necessary clearance for making amendments to A.P. Electricity Regulatory Commission Act

title: Guntur’s Nallapadu Lake all set to get a facelift, says Union Minister

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu promises full support to hotel industry in Andhra Pradesh
content: Promising to extend special incentives for those investing in State, he says there is a great opportunity for tourism development in Chittoor and Srisailam

title: Phone tapping: Shravan Kumar Rao appears before SIT for questioning
content: Along with Mr. Rao, a Red Corner Notice was also issued against former Special Intelligence Bureau (SIB) Chief T. Prabhakar Rao, another accused in the case.

title: Light to moderate showers likely in Andhra Pradesh from March 31 to April 4
content: Thunderstorms accompanied with lightning and gusty winds, touching 30 to 40 kmph, are likely at isolated places over North Coastal Andhra Pradesh, Yanam and South Coastal Andhra Pradesh

title: Why has X sued the government over SAHYOG? | Explained
content: What is Section 79(3)(b) of the Information Technology Act? Why is X calling SAHYOG a ‘censorship portal’? Is there a move to bypass the limited safeguards under Section 69A of the IT Act, which allows content blocking only on specific grounds such as national security?

content: What are the issues raised by the Public Accounts Committee on the working of the GST on collection of taxes?

title: GCDA Budget mulls land pooling for third phase of Infopark development
content: Of the 300 acres, a total of 100 acres will be set apart for IT firms, while hotels, hospitals, sports and recreational arenas will be built in the remaining space; software-backed automated parking lots to be readied at multiple places in Kochi

title: Iftar parties, platform for high and mighty, vehicle of harmony, now out of currency in Uttar Pradesh
content: Ram Naik was the last Governor to host one in 2019, and 2016 marked the last time an Iftar gathering was hosted by a CM — Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav.

title: Rajeev Chandrasekhar: From business to politics
content: The media entrepreneur and former Union Minister, who has been appointed as the BJP’s president in Kerala, says his mission is to see an NDA government in the southern State, which has long remained elusive for the saffron party

title: The wait for rural local body elections in Tamil Nadu
content: More than 9,500 village panchayats in Tamil Nadu do not have elected members to represent the grievances of the residents. T. Ramakrishnan finds out that people are not happy with this void at the grassroots level and have begun to call for elections to these posts without delay.

title: Almost 30% of MHA’s takedown notices to X target posts on Union Ministers, government agencies
content: MHA targeted 1.1 lakh pieces of content this year; notices sent on X posts mocking PM, manipulated video of the HM, satirical video on the MoS for Home; police say SAHYOG portal still in trial stage

title: Sources: Maryland's Willard takes Villanova job
content: Kevin Willard, who led Maryland to the Sweet 16 of this season's NCAA tournament, has accepted Villanova's offer to become the program's head basketball coach, sources told ESPN.

title: Duke tames Tide for school's 18th Final Four bid
content: Top-seeded Duke took the next step in its seasonlong quest, defeating No. 2 Alabama 85-65 to advance to next week's Final Four in San Antonio.

title: L.A.'s Sasaki gets quick hook: Didn't have 'stuff'
content: Roki Sasaki's Dodger Stadium debut ended in the second inning Saturday night after the touted right-hander again struggled with his control.

title: Clayton's Curry-like flurry helps Gators escape
content: Florida All-American guard Walter Clayton Jr. caught fire late, leading a comeback over Texas Tech that has the Gators in the Final Four.

title: Geno on Bueckers' 40: As good as I've seen her
content: Paige Bueckers exploded for 29 of her career-best 40 points in the second half, carrying UConn to an 82-59 rout over Oklahoma in the Sweet 16.

title: Devers first to open year with 10 K's in 3 games
content: Boston Red Sox designated hitter Rafael Devers became the first major league player to strike out 10 times in the first three games of a season.

title: Minus JuJu, USC flexes 'chemistry,' bounces KSU
content: Playing for the first time since learning JuJu Watkins will miss the rest of the NCAA tournament with an ACL tear, the USC Trojans used key contributions from their freshman class to defeat the Kansas State Wildcats 67-61 and advance to the Elite Eight.

title: Lakers answer Redick's challenge, top Grizzlies
content: After Los Angeles coach JJ Redick challenged his stars in a Saturday meeting to use more creativity on the floor, LeBron James and the Lakers later responded with a 134-127 win over the Memphis Grizzlies, an effort in which the club shot 50.6% overall.

title: Women's March Madness: Reaction, analysis as Elite Eight is set
content: Everything you need to know as the Elite Eight is set in the women's NCAA tournament games on Saturday.

title: What this historic day of home runs says about Aaron Judge, Yankees
content: Judge's three homer game helped New York make long ball history and reminded us just how good the slugger is.

title: NHL playoff watch: Who will win the Atlantic Division crown?
content: The Panthers, Leafs and Lightning are locked in a battle. Plus, updated projections for the playoff bracket.

title: Power Rankings: Latest updated poll, plus each team's strength of schedule
content: As the playoff field solidifies, here's how our panel voted, along with each team's slate through April 17.

title: Forecasting next season for women's eliminated top seeds
content: NC State has been eliminated. From portal priorities to incoming recruits, we look ahead to the Wolfpack next season.

title: Inside the unprecedented transformation of Steinbrenner Field
content: The Yankees' spring training facility became the Rays' Opening Day ballpark in just four days. Here's how.

title: Messi scores 2 minutes into return in Miami win
content: Lionel Messi scored two minutes after coming off the substitutes' bench as Inter Miami beat the Philadelphia Union 2-1 at Chase Stadium on Saturday.

title: Trinity Rodman: Back likely never will be 100%
content: USWNT star Trinity Rodman has given a sober assessment of her ongoing back issues, saying she doesn't think it will ever be fully healthy again.

title: Mbappé: 'Very special' to match Ronaldo tally
content: Kylian Mbappé said matching Cristiano Ronaldo's goal tally in his debut Real Madrid season is "very special" after scoring twice in a 3-2 comeback win over Leganés on Saturday.

title: Guardiola: My performance has been 'really poor'
content: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola has said his own efforts this season have been "really poor" as his side struggle to recapture their title-winning form.

title: Canada insists injured Davies got 'proper care'
content: The Canadian soccer federation defended its handling of star player Alphonso Davies after Bayern Munich threatened to take legal action in the aftermath of his serious injury suffered during the Concacaf Nations League finals.

title: Tudor gets unlikely assist in debut as Juve coach
content: New Juventus coach Igor Tudor had a direct role in the Bianconeri's first goal since he replaced the fired Thiago Motta.

title: Forest reach 1st FA Cup semifinal since 1991
content: Nottingham Forest secured a place in the FA Cup semi-finals by beating Brighton & Hove Albion 4-3 in a penalty shootout when Ryan Yates smashed home the winner after the game finished goalless following extra time.

title: Reports: Blitzer close to selling RSL, Utah Royals
content: Billionaire businessman David Blitzer is in advanced talks to sell a large stake in both Real Salt Lake of MLS and the Utah Royals of NWSL after owning both franchises since 2022, according to multiple reports.

title: Mayer and Price are the best welterweights; now they need to fight
content: After anther victory, the only thing between Mikaela Mayer and the undisputed championship is Lauren Price.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid plan shocking move for Fernandes
content: Will Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes replace Luka Modric in Real Madrid's midfield? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Over 6 Killed After Strong Winds Uproot Tree In Himachal Tourist Area
content: Over six people have died after a storm uprooted a tree, which fell on vehicles and food stalls in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu this evening. A relief and rescue operation is currently underway.

title: "Did Anyone Die?" Lamborghini Driver After Hitting 2 Workers On Footpath
content: A red Lamborghini struck two pedestrians on a footpath adjacent to an under-construction complex in Noida's Sector 94 this evening.

title: Myanmar Earthquake Aftermath: Satellite Images Show Huge-Scale Destruction
content: The stench of decaying dead bodies permeated the air in Mandalay-- Myanmar's second-largest city-- on Sunday, two days after a massive earthquake killed at least 1,700 people and left countless others buried.

title: Live: Death Count In Myanmar Touches 1,700, Rises To 17 In Bangkok
content: Myanmar, Thailand, Bangkok Earthquake LIVE Updates: The number of deaths caused by a massive earthquake that hit Myanmar and Thailand rose in both countries on Sunday.

title: UP Teen Barred From Taking Exam Over Rs 800 School Dues, Dies By Suicide
content: A 17-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh's Pratapgarh district has died by suicide after school authorities allegedly barred her from taking an exam because her school fee of Rs 800 had not been paid.

title: 17 Cuts Planned In L2 Empuraan After Gujarat Riots References Spark Row
content: Malayalam movie L2 Empuraan, which hit theatres on Thursday, will undergo 17 cuts amid the controversy over its references to the 2002 Gujarat riots, the film's production team has confirmed. The new version will be released in theatres next week

title: "Hamas Leaders In Gaza Can Leave If...": Netanyahu's Latest Terms
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Sunday that Israel's intensified military pressure on Hamas in Gaza has been effective, stressing the Palestinian group must lay down its arms.

title: China Connection Emerges In Bangkok Skyscraper That Collapsed During Quake
content: A Chinese-backed construction firm is being investigated over the collapse of a 33-storey high-rise in Thailand's Bangkok during Friday's 7.7-magnitude earthquake that struck central Myanmar.

title: 'This Has Become Popular': ChatGPT Briefly Goes Down Amid Ghibli Art Trend
content: ChatGPT, the popular AI chatbot developed by OpenAI, was down for several users on Sunday with its servers overwhelmed by a surge in demand for its new Studio Ghibli-style image generation feature.

title: IPL 2025 Live: CSK Opt To Bowl vs RR, Make 2 Big Changes After Loss
content: Rajasthan Royals vs Chennai Super Kings LIVE Score, IPL 2025 LIVE: CSK captain Ruturaj Gaikwad won the toss and opted to bowl vs RR

title: Sam Altman Says OpenAI Team "Needs Sleep" As Ghibli-Style AI Art Goes Viral
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has called for a pause as social media is overrun with AI-generated Studio Ghibli-style images.

title: Video: German Startup's Space Rocket Explodes 40 Seconds After Liftoff
content: A test rocket aimed at kickstarting satellite launches from Europe fell to the ground and exploded 40 seconds after takeoff from a Norwegian space port on Sunday, in what German startup Isar Aerospace had described as an initial test.

title: "Powerful Hands Behind...": Shock 'Cover Up' Claim Over Shane Warne Death
content: A report, quoting a police officer from the site of Shane Warne's death, has claimed that a controversial item was removed on the order of some senior people.

title: "He Continued To Masturbate": Woman Sues US Airline Over Harassment
content: A woman has filed a lawsuit against American Airlines, alleging that a cabin crew member dismissed her complaints after a male passenger masturbated next to her for nearly an hour during a flight.

title: Why US Is Asking Hundreds Of International Students To Self-Deport
content: Hundreds of international students studying in the US have received emails from the US Department of State (DOS), telling them to self-deport as their F-1 visas (student visas) have been revoked owing to campus activism.

title: "Violation Of Democratic Rights": Pinarayi Vijayan On Row Over New Movie
content: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan voiced support for the movie "Empuraan" today, and accused the Sangh Parivar of fostering an "atmosphere of fear" over the film.

title: Rahul Dravid inspects Guwahati pitch in wheelchair
content: Rajasthan Royals head coach Rahul Dravid, despite being on a wheelchair due to a recent injury, remains dedicated to his team’s IPL 2025 campaign. Dravid continues to actively participate, inspecting pitches and motivating the team, who have yet to win a match in the ongoing tournament. Meanwhile, Chennai Super Kings skipper Ruturaj Gaikwad won the toss and opted to bowl against Rajasthan Royals.

title: Ghibli style image converter: Guide to turn your photos into an animation video
content: Social media is currently abuzz with Ghibli-style photo trends, featuring dreamy, pastel images. Utilizing AI tools and hand-drawn art, creators are now turning these into animation videos. This guide explains the step-by-step process to produce your own Ghibli-inspired short animation.

title: 1 dead after 11 coaches of Bengaluru-Kamakhya Express derail in Odisha
content: At least 11 coaches of the Bangalore-Kamakhya AC Superfast Express derailed near Nergundi station in Cuttack district on Sunday. No injuries were reported. Senior railway officials and relief trains have been dispatched. A special train is being arranged for stranded passengers. The cause of the derailment is under investigation.

title: OpenAI CEO to users making Ghibli images using ChatGPT: Let team sleep...
content: OpenAI's Sam Altman has requested users to reduce the generation of Ghibli-style images, stressing the strain on his team. Other AI platforms such as Google's Gemini and Grok can also produce similar visuals, though the output might vary. Free options like Craiyon and DeepAI offer alternative solutions.

title: Happy Eid-ul-Fitr 2025: Hindi Shayari, Wishes, Messages, Quotes, and Poems
content: Eid is a significant celebration for Muslims worldwide, marking the end of the holy month of Ramadan. The article provides wishes, messages, and poems for Eid al-Fitr 2023. It emphasizes gratitude, charity, togetherness, and prayers, allowing families and friends to share their love and blessings.

title: KKR handed massive Sunil Narine fitness update ahead of MI clash
content: Kolkata Knight Riders head coach Chandrakant Pandit confirms Sunil Narine’s return for the clash against Mumbai Indians after recovering from illness. Narine’s presence will enhance KKR's bowling attack and offers an additional batting option as they aim for their second consecutive win in the IPL season.

title: How to create Ghibli-style Portraits without paying for ChatGPT Plus
content: OpenAI's GPT-4o update, which creates Studio Ghibli-style portraits, is currently restricted to paid subscription tiers due to high demand. However, users can still generate Ghibli-inspired art for free using alternatives like Gemini, GrokAI models, and other third-party tools, or by leveraging free trials on premium AI platforms.

title: Aniket Verma: The SRH hitter who scored maiden IPL fifty
content: Aniket Verma's explosive 74 off 41 balls powered Sunrisers Hyderabad against Delhi Capitals, lifting them from 37/4 to a competitive total. His innings featured 4 fours and 6 sixes, with a strike rate of 180.49. Verma’s aggressive play against top bowlers like Mitchell Starc provided SRH hope in a challenging match, demonstrating his value to the team.

title: Wife of Patnaik's top aide takes VRS from IAS, fuels buzz of political plunge
content: Senior IAS officer Sujata Rout Karthikeyan has taken voluntary retirement, sparking rumors of her entry into politics. Sujata, who was serving in the finance department, dismissed these speculations, citing personal reasons for her resignation. Her departure follows her husband VK Pandian's earlier retirement and subsequent low-profile entry into the BJD.

title: 'Military pressure on Hamas working': Netanyahu pushes for Trump plan
content: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu asserts that military pressure is creating cracks in Hamas negotiations. Despite ongoing conflicts and rising casualties, Israel demands Hamas disarm and leave Gaza, aiming to implement the Trump plan, while international allies support the nation’s efforts.

title: 'Duty to ensure my movies ...': Mohanlal apologises amid 'Empuraan' row
content: Superstar Mohanlal has apologized for distress caused by political and social themes in his latest film L2: Empuraan. Following backlash, the production team decided to remove contentious elements, with changes suggested by the CBFC. Despite controversies, the film has achieved significant box office success.

title: Record! India's Gulveer sets new national high in 10,000m event
content: Indian athlete Gulveer Singh broke his own national record in the men's 10,000m event at the Ten 2025 athletics meet in San Juan Capistrano, USA, with a time of 27:00.22s. This new record is 14.66 seconds faster than his previous one, set in Japan in 2024.

title: Afspa extended across most of Manipur for six months
content: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has extended the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act (AFSPA) in Manipur, Nagaland, and Arunachal Pradesh for six more months due to ongoing security concerns. The move aims to address insurgency and maintain order amid continued ethnic violence, particularly in Manipur since May 2023.

title: Carmelo Anthony and La La Anthony are always ready to support their son Kiyan
content: Kiyan Anthony shined as the star player for Lutheran High School during The Throne basketball tournament, leading his team to an 83-56 victory over the William J. Brennan Bears in the semifinals. His parents, Carmelo and La La Anthony, were present to cheer him on.

title: Fact check: Did Parthiv Patel say 'MI is missing captain Rohit Sharma'?
content: Misinformation troubles cricketers and analysts during IPL 2025, as evidenced by false statements attributed to former players. Parthiv Patel debunked a fake quote involving Rohit Sharma, and Aakash Chopra addressed edited commentary clips. These incidents underscore the persistent issue of fake news in sports media, forcing figures to continually refute misleading content.

title: Myanmar quake: Chinese firm under fire after Bangkok skyscraper collapse
content: A Chinese construction company is being investigated after a Bangkok skyscraper collapsed during a 7.7 magnitude earthquake that struck Myanmar, killing at least 17 people and trapping dozens. Engineers had previously raised concerns about the building's structural integrity, citing rapid construction and inadequate materials.

title: PM Modi praises RSS for its role in nation-building with Bhagwat by his side
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised the RSS for its contributions to India's development during a foundation ceremony in Hingna. He highlighted the organization's humanitarian efforts and underscored the importance of youth in nation-building, emphasizing India's leadership in global crises and the ongoing effort to erase colonial remnants.

title: Jaipur-Chennai SpiceJet flight makes emergency landing after tyre burst
content: A Chennai-bound flight from Jaipur experienced a tyre burst before landing, prompting an emergency landing. All passengers and crew members landed safely. The pilot noticed the issue and alerted authorities, who followed standard emergency protocols. Visual inspection revealed damage to wheel no. 2. Jaipur ATC reported detecting a tyre fragment on the runway.

title: IPL: KL Rahul returns for DC vs SRH - who is out of Playing XI?
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad opted to bat against Delhi Capitals in the IPL match. Pat Cummins leads SRH with Zeeshan Ansari replacing Simranjeet Singh. Delhi's KL Rahul joins the squad after missing the opening match for family reasons. Both teams are looking to execute their strategies under the hot conditions of Visakhapatnam.

title: AI vs. Humans: Bill Gates reveals three jobs that are safe from automation
content: Bill Gates remarks that AI represents a profound advancement, capable of solving complex problems and transforming activities like health and education. Despite this, Gates believes AI won't replace coders, biologists, and energy experts due to the nuances and creativity required in these fields.

title: 'Insaan hu, bhagwaan nahi': Harbhajan on Sreesanth episode
content: Former Indian spinner Harbhajan Singh admitted on social media that slapping S Sreesanth during the 2008 IPL season was a mistake. The incident, which occurred after a match between Kings XI Punjab and Mumbai Indians, led to Harbhajan's suspension and an 11-match ban.

title: Kunal Kamra joke row: How parties change stand in free-speech debate
content: India's Article 19 faces scrutiny amid political controversy as parties selectively defend free speech based on power dynamics. Incidents involving comedian Kunal Kamra, opposition figures, and various criticisms highlight the inconsistency in upholding this constitutional right. Experts call for clearer definitions to protect artistic expression and emphasize accountability for misusing restrictions to curb free speech.

title: 'Things are slipping away for Rohit Sharma': Manjrekar
content: Sanjay Manjrekar has raised concerns about Rohit Sharma's recent form, suggesting extra effort is required to maintain his performance levels. Sharma's struggles were evident in the IPL, scoring only eight runs against the Gujarat Titans. Despite this, Manjrekar remains hopeful for Mumbai Indians' recovery, emphasizing the need for strategic adjustments in their batting lineup.

title: RR vs CSK: Dream 11 Team Prediction, head to head, Barsapara Stadium pitch report
content: Rajasthan Royals aim to avoid a third consecutive defeat as they face Chennai Super Kings in IPL 2025 in Guwahati. CSK, recovering from a heavy loss against RCB, hope the slower Guwahati pitch benefits their spin attack. Weather is predicted to be warm and pleasant.

title: Eid Mubarak 2025: 50+ wishes, messages, and quotes to share
content: Eid-ul-Fitr, marking the end of Ramadan, is a significant Islamic festival celebrated globally. It signifies spiritual growth and is observed with prayers, feasts, and acts of charity. As Eid Mubarak 2025 approaches, the article highlights 50 heartfelt wishes and messages to share, enhancing the festive joy. Celebrations emphasize compassion, unity, and love within the community.

title: 'He can do anything to us': Rape survivor's father on Asaram Bapu's fresh bail
content: Asaram Bapu, who is serving a life sentence for raping a minor, has been granted an extension of interim bail by the Gujarat High Court for medical reasons. The survivor's father expressed fears for his family's safety, alleging that Asaram is influencing people and managing to secure multiple bail extensions. Authorities are monitoring the family's security.

title: A few km apart in Mumbai, a 13°C temperature gap
content: Dense construction and decreasing greenery in Mumbai create varying temperatures across suburbs. In March 2025, Powai recorded 13.1 degrees Celsius cooler than Ghatkopar, highlighting the Urban Heat Island effect. Experts stress the need for more trees and customized climate mitigation plans across different city zones to counter rising heat.

title: PM Modi praises Hanumankind for promoting 'traditional martial arts' in new song
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday praised Kerala-born rapper Hanumankind for promoting India's traditional culture through his song 'Run It Up,' which highlights traditional martial arts like Kalari-payattu. The song has topped the Official Asian Music Chart. PM Modi also extended greetings for Chaitra Navratri, Eid, and other upcoming festivals.

title: With Rs 226 crore income since 2022-23, IMD now a money-spinner
content: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has become a significant revenue generator for the Ministry of Earth Sciences, earning over Rs 226 crore since 2022-23. This income largely comes from aviation meteorological services provided to the Airports Authority of India. Additionally, revenue is also generated through the sale of meteorological data, weather reports, and testing/calibration of equipment.

title: 'Trying to write new story': Ranveer Allahbadia resumes podcast on YouTube
content: YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia has resumed 'The Ranveer Show' after facing public backlash over the 'India's Got Latent' controversy. He expressed gratitude to his supporters and reflected on his growth during the hiatus. Allahbadia emphasized creating responsible content in the future and promised a new phase of high-quality content, particularly focusing on India's history and culture.

title: 'Institutionalised extraction': MK Stalin on hike in ATM cash withdrawal charges
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin criticizes RBI's decision to allow banks to increase ATM withdrawal charges beyond the free monthly limits, calling it 'institutionalised extraction' affecting financial inclusion. He claims the move will burden the poor, particularly MGNREGA beneficiaries, undermining their access to banking services and essential government schemes.
